newsitem.title: USA: US Treasury issues clarification on indexed notes.
newsitem.headline: US Treasury issues clarification on indexed notes.

text.p: The U.S. Treasury Department's Bureau of Public Debt on Friday issued a clarification on the settlement amount that buyers must pay for the 10-year inflation-indexed notes auctioned last Wednesday.
A buyer must pay Treasury $996.87 for each $1,000 face value note for settlement including accrued interest. The notes will be issued on Feb 6 and mature on Jan 15, 2007.
Treasury said there was some confusion apparent among dealers in interpreting its formula for calculating the settlement amount, so it was issuing the clarification in response to their requests.
The settlement amount would be $9,968.73 for a $10,000 note, rising to $99,687,323 for a $100,000 note.
